title.narrative: Sustainable Rural Infrastructure Development Project in Northern Mountain Provinces

description.narrative: The project will rehabilitate and upgrade deteriorated but critical rural infrastructure in 15 mountainous provinces of northern Viet Nam. These provinces have a combined population of 12.2 million people and are among the poorest in the country. Overall poverty rates average about 27%, but are considerably higher in more isolated areas, where poverty levels may be 50%-60%. One of the main reasons for these high levels of poverty is limited access to productive assets and infrastructure (such as irrigation water systems), and physical isolation. The project will focus on improving small- to medium-scale irrigation and/or drainage systems, rural roads, and district and commune markets. The project will include 40-45 subprojects. Rehabilitation and upgrading of rural infrastructure is expected to have a positive impact on the lives and livelihoods of the population in the project area, providing easier access to inputs (including irrigation water), markets, health services, higher levels of education, and employment opportunities, while reducing production and marketing costs.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: The intended outcome is to increase access to, and use of priority rural infrastructure by the poor and ethnic minorities in the project area.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
1.2. Cropping intensity in irrigation command areas increased by 30% after commissioning and no later than 2017

description.narrative: The intended outcome is to increase access to, and use of priority rural infrastructure by the poor and ethnic minorities in the project area.

title.narrative:
2. Roads and markets
2.1. Producer surplus increased by 20% by 2017 - induced by increased farm-gate market prices for agricultural produce and greater access to production inputs

description.narrative: The intended outcome is to increase access to, and use of priority rural infrastructure by the poor and ethnic minorities in the project area.

title.narrative: 2.2 Travel indicators: VOC reduced by 60%; travel time reduced by 50%; traffic volume increased by 200% by 2017

description.narrative: The intended outcome is to increase access to, and use of priority rural infrastructure by the poor and ethnic minorities in the project area.

title.narrative: 2.3. Within one year of subproject completion: Average increase in annual traffic 8% in tons and 7% in ton-km, of which 60% will be agricultural surpluses

description.narrative: The intended outcome is to increase access to, and use of priority rural infrastructure by the poor and ethnic minorities in the project area.

title.narrative: 2.4. Within one year of subproject completion: Average increase in passenger volumes: 12% in passengers and 10% in passenger-km

description.narrative: The intended outcome is to increase access to, and use of priority rural infrastructure by the poor and ethnic minorities in the project area.

title.narrative:
From baselines in 2011 in subproject of influence:
1. Irrigation
1.1 Rice yields per ha in irrigation command areas increased by 25% immediately after commissioning and no later than 2017

description.narrative: The intended outcome is to increase access to, and use of priority rural infrastructure by the poor and ethnic minorities in the project area.
